newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft sets new personal finance software.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft sets new personal finance software.

text.p: Microsoft Corp. said Monday it has created new personal finance software that allows consumers to pay bills electronically and keep track of their finances over the computer.

The latest version of Money 97 includes, for the first time, a tool to convert Intuit Inc.'s Quicken software data into Money data to encourage users to switch the software they use, Microsoft said. The suggested retail price is $34.95.
The Redmond, Wash.-based software company also announced the formation of the first multimedia production studio for the Internet.
The studio, Microsoft Multimedia Productions, was formed to bring independently produced entertainment programming to the Microsoft Network, the company's Internet online service.
Microsoft plans to make the Microsoft Network the first online service to debut on the World Wide Web later this fall.
